alert.note: Alert for Jo Daviess; Stephenson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 5:09AM CDT until August 07 at 11:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in Quad Cities has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Jo Daviess County in northwestern Illinois... Stephenson County in northwestern Illinois... * Until 1115 AM CDT Sunday. * At 509 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen, especially from around Freeport to Lena, McConnell, Orangeville and Cedarville. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Freeport, Lena, Stockton, Warren, Pearl City, Cedarville, Davis, Dakota, German Valley, Apple River, Winslow, Rock City, Ridott, Nora, Buena Vista, Loran, Rock Grove, Oneco, Orangeville and Kent. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
